tweets.text: @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Sorry for being ignorant, but why would people spend the time and effort on this vandalism, which presumably took days?

We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

@TheMichaelMoran @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency It‚Äôs hard to see what the purpose of this could be. It‚Äôs terribly tragic and has a feeling of vandalism about it. Could someone be so misinformed to think this was ok? Must have taken huge amount of labour to achieve too.
@RobGMacfarlane @FreyaLouisa @EnvAgency It‚Äôs not clear who is responsible and what they were trying to achieve

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t
We're taking reports of environmental damage to the #SSSI at the #RiverLugg very seriously, and are working with @EnvAgency and @ForestryComm to take immediate action. https://t.co/27DINp3vD7

@CountryfileMag @LeeEvansWales @GlassJet @EnvAgency @WildlifeTrusts Why didn‚Äôt the locals, who must have witnessed this happening, do or say something at the time. This must have taken days to be completed. Shame on them, too...

@DaveThroupEA @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Will be watching you @NaturalEngland carefully and monitoring you regularly in future to check that you take your role to monitor and protect our natural environment seriously.
@bbchw @EnvAgencyMids @HerefordshireWT Shocking news. Who ever passed planning for this wants shooting

"Be in no doubt that anything less than a prosecution and full restoration of the river, paid for by the perpetrator, will be acceptable‚Äù.

@EnvAgency and others want to prove they are fit for the 21st century? Here's your chance. https://t.co/ji0wmcYyhf

While there's understandable outrage at a case of wanton destruction of a beautiful riverbank, #HS2Ltd's #17billion #HS2GravyTrain is given a free pass to daily trash #EnglandsGreenAndPleasantLand, that is neither HS2 Ltd's nor the Tories' to trash.
#NHSNotHS2
#HabitatDestruction https://t.co/ZsKP5mAxvh

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Sorry to be me, but I want all animal and countryside abusers and torturers named and shamed. He now has to pay for everything to be put right. He‚Äôs a fat f*** and can afford it. Probably kicks his animals around too.
Our piece by @GlassJet on the depressing news of the destruction of a stretch of Herefordshire's River Lugg  @EnvAgency @WildlifeTrusts  https://t.co/CaNN4WVP5J

In 2015 Storm Desmond hit Cumbria flooding many areas including the town of #Egremont. 
 
5 years on and #TeamEA are investing 12 million on a flood scheme for the town with works ongoing to better protect 220 properties from flooding. 
 
For more info - https://t.co/UibqT7Itw6 https://t.co/kDcqp2sM3E

urls.title: Cumbria | The Flood Hub
urls.description: This local spaces area will provide information o n our aim to manage flood risk on a catchment scale from Source to Sea. In this section we will introduce you to Cumbria Strategic Flood Partnership, a collective of organisations that coordinates all flood risk management planning and delivery and detailed information on Flood Risk Management Schemes being delivered.

tweets.text:
Curiouser and curiouser.

The redoubtable @bettwsresident CEO of @WUFoundation making it very clear  that @EnvAgencyMids were alerted to the destruction that was taking place on the River Lugg last week. 

Did EA the respond? If not why not.

Starts 8:37

https://t.co/XbNCDTpqIL

@TCNAndrew @deepredfish @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil @guardian @guardianphotos @TelegraphPics Of course. They may understand that too. But as long as the water races through their land without flooding their house they don't care. The people downstream are of no importance to them.
The land and property owners upstream of them may think the same way.

@Nelliefarmhouse @NaomiLWood @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency 2/3
This site has one of the highest environmental protections.
Damn right I disagree.
This will cause major problems for a lot of good farmers just when they don‚Äôt need it.
Sorry to be be blunt but you have no idea what you are talking about on this subject.

@Nelliefarmhouse @NaomiLWood @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency 7. Bare, unprotected banks will erode in subsequent floods
8. Re-profiled, unvegetated banks further speed the flow and increase flooding risk downstream.
9. Bare banks are uninhabitable by all animals and birds.
Just to number a few disastrous problems over a 1 mile length.

@Nelliefarmhouse @NaomiLWood @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency 1. The protected salmon & trout have just spawned - destroyed.
2. Aquatic insects destroyed.
3. Riparian habitat destroyed.
4. Bat lines destroyed.
5. Standing dead wood destroyed.
6. Increased flow rates downstream washing out: trout & salmon eggs and insects.
1/2

tweets.text: @denny_robert @NaomiLWood @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @denny_robert Why is everyone getting so het up about this - it done a good job imo....  Wildlife is resilient & will soon recover.. The Lugg floods when when it is mizzling, it needs cleaning out..   I know you won't agree Rob...

@dudnees @deepredfish @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil @guardian @guardianphotos @TelegraphPics Quoted from wildlife trusts: "Removing all bankside vegetation and scraping out the riverbed and banks will cause a huge increase in the speed the water moves through the river and increases the flood risk downstream." Only a fool would think something like this has flood benefit

@NaomiLWood @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Any fine will be calculated on many factors and the profit of the enterprise. Farmers profits are doubtful in the best of years.
The RPA might deliver a bigger slap as a percentage reduction in BPS.
@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Where is the unlike option for this? What a pity when whild landscape is devasted

Expecting to hear a lot more from @EnvAgency about this bit. A lot more. Seems like most of the damage to the Lugg could have been prevented if EA had Actually. Done. Anything. when the initial report was made, rather than 8 days later.

https://t.co/TFpElReUQZ https://t.co/C90bL64rRM
@MissLed20 @FreyaLouisa @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Apparently not. No-one is owning up to the industrial scale vandalism because, I suspect, they know it‚Äôs indefensible
@Sophie_Clare3 @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil @HerefordshireWT Do you know who the land owner is, please?

@deepredfish @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil @guardian @guardianphotos @TelegraphPics Is it perhaps an effort by the owners of that property in the background of this image to protect it from flooding?
It's clearly prone.

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Well done - EA Drone operator surveying damage at River Lugg at Kingsland site this afternoon - picture editors more at Alamy Live News @guardian @guardianphotos #riverlugg @TelegraphPics https://t.co/SBFVor1VIu

The first beaver dam in over 400 years appeared on Exmoor after beavers were released into the wild in January.

These rodents can play an important role in engineering the landscape and helping to restore streams and reduce #flooding.

Learn more: https://t.co/h7VascPfWg

urls.title: Beavers build first Exmoor dam in 400 years
urls.description: The National Trust says the dam in Somerset "might look modest, but it is incredibly special".

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency It was, at least, reported on #bbcradio4 this morning. I think a prosecution, hefty ¬£2million fine and full cost of restoration by proper river people is the least that should happen to the perpetrators. Can the land be confiscated?
@FreyaLouisa @TheMichaelMoran @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Surely there would have had to be council approval for this? in which case they are also culpable
